content: Yes, it's the same procedure. You'll still have the original and a copy of it on the other PC.
creator: siffemoz

content: This is not a thunderbird setting, but possibly enforced either by your email provider, OR the ones who receive it last may be with an email provider that sees the message as spam. Sometimes, there are error messages that can assist in solving this. I suggest you investigate using one of the many free email mailing list organizations, such as Mailchip (or others), as these providers do a far better job than any email client can achieve.
creator: davidsk

content: Did you verify the sort order ( Cick on View and then Sort ) . What is your current sort order ?

content:
Please provide details. We can't use the history. Is this an IMAP account? I think you mentioned that some of the messages are on PC and some onlline. What is needed is an explanation of what you have now, and what you want to then do. With that, I think some suggestions will come forth. Thank you.

AND, please DO NOT post twice on the forum, as you did.
